    • Method Detail

      • disableGeofences

        public void disableGeofences()
        Explicitly disable geofence support. This is set by default (i.e. no geofence support). It is as a convenience method to allow apps to disable geofence support at a later time.

      • enableGeofences

        public void enableGeofences()
                     throws GooglePlayServicesException
        Explicitly enable geofence support. Apps wanting to use geofences must call this method before calling start(). It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the application has properly included and configured the Google Play services library. Additionally, it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the device supports Google Play services. Failure to ensure these will result in a GooglePlayServicesException.
        Throws:
        GooglePlayServicesException - It is the client's responsibility to ensure that Google Play services is properly listed as a dependency, configured, and then available on the device. This exception is thrown under several conditions:
        • Google Play services library is not listed as dependencies by the calling app
        • Google Play services are not properly configured in the calling app
        • The calling app failed to disable geofence when Google Play services were not available on the device
        See Also:
        Setup Google Play services , Checking if Google Play services is available

      • getInstanceForApplication

        public static ProximityKitManager getInstanceForApplication(Context context)
        An accessor for the singleton instance of this class. A context must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

      • getBeaconManager

        public BeaconManager getBeaconManager()
        Convenience method to access the beacon manager
        Returns:

      • debugOn

        public static void debugOn()

      • start

        public void start()
        Syncs data from ProximityKit, and once the sync is done, starts looking for beacons matching the beacon regions set up in ProximityKit, pre-enabling monitoring, ranging, and data callbacks to the ProximityKitSyncNotifier

      • restart

        public void restart()
        This method is used to reconfigure the ProximityKit properties at runtime There is no need to call this method if you are configurng ProximityKit from a .properties file.

      • restart

        public void restart(java.lang.String code)

      • setKit

        public void setKit(Kit kit)
        Used by the system when sync'ing data form the server. Should not be called by end users.
        Parameters:
        kit -

      • getBeaconAdapter

        public com.radiusnetworks.proximity.proximitykit.BeaconAdapter getBeaconAdapter()

      • setConfiguration

        public void setConfiguration(java.lang.String pkApiUrl,
                    java.lang.String pkApiToken)
        Configure ProximityKit to use a specific url and token for a kit after calling this method, the user should call start() to sync with the server. If the client app is switching to a different kit, the restart() method should call restart() instead of start() after calling this method.

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(long milliseconds)
        Sets the length of time between sync. In the event that the proximity kit is updated, the app must sync in order to receive this new information. However, syncing does tax battery life significantly if performed too often, so we do not recommend setting this very low. This is set at one hour by default. The minimum setting is 5 minutes (300000 milliseconds).
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Number of minutes to wait between each sync with Proximity Kit.
